channel.title: Publication on Guttulous L∞ps
channel.description: Recent content in Publication on Guttulous L∞ps

item.title: Mû, a board game with five elements
item.description: Available in HTML5 Godot being amazing, I exported an HTML5 build of the game that you can run in your web browser. Play the HTML5 Demo The Rules of Mû You win by achieving any of the following: Reach the top of the opponent’s hill. Capture both the opponent’s priests. Capture all the opponent’s pawns. Movement Pawns and priests move alike, to one of the three tiles in front of them, if it is on the board and not already occupied by another pawn.

item.title: AVS Réseaux, a lightweight webpage
item.description: Here’s an example of a lightweight webpage made for AVS Réseaux. As usual, it’s an A-grade website, validating the pre-DRM W3C.

item.title: Cubik Architecture
item.description: Responds to size, orientation, fullscreen or windowed image swiping. Crafted with pleasure and talented modern designer Joffrey Jochum. Visit the website

item.title: Doodle away !
item.description: I experimented a bit with canvas and paper.js, and made an online doodle app working quite nicely on powerful tablets. You can fork the whole project on github. The trick was to have two separate canvases, one for the path being drawn, and the other for the paths already drawn. PaperScript’s tricky clever scoping is inspiring — my usage of it feels like a hack. Remember to press C for Free Cake© once you’ve drawn some lines !

item.title: Elfassy Barrès Associés
item.description: Very light, very fast, highly responsive, generated using Phrozn. It’s also using twitter 1.1 OAuth'd API to get the homepage feed. Crafted with pleasure and designer Joffrey Jochum. Review the A-grade benchmark, or visit the website.

item.title: Styles'n Scroll into Driver Trends
item.description: Crafted with pleasure at Diplomatic Cover. Visit the website, or read some source code. There’s less than 40k of javascript, including libraries and the Ubibar’s overhead.
